page.title: 08INDUSTRY-A FRUIT FARM
page.content: AROUND WEST BERGHOLT,BOXTED,AND GREAT HORKESLEY THERE ARE MANY FRUIT FARMS. THESE ARE OWNED EITHER BY LOCAL FOLK,OR BY A LARGE COMPANY IN LONDON, THAT EMPLOYS A MANAGER TO RUN THEM. THEY GROW APPLES,PLUMS,PEARS,STRAW- BERRIES,AND RASPBERRIES.IN THE WINTER WHEN THE WEATHER IS BAD THE GROUND IS COVERED IN FUNNY LOOKING PLASTIC SHEETS WHICH KEEP THE COLD OUT.VERY FEW PEOPLE WORK ON THE FARMS DURING THE WINTER,BUT IN THE SUMMER THE FRUIT HAS TO BE PICKED QIUCKLY WHEN IT IS RIPE.THE FARMS ADVERTISE FOR PICKERS, AND ALL SORTS OF PEOPLE GO AND PICK THE FRUIT-HOUSEWIFES,STUDENTS,AND EVEN OLD AGE PENSIONERS.ONE LARGE COMPANY HAS ITS OWN BUS TO TAKE THE PICKERS BACK INTO COLCHESTER AT THE END OF A HARD DAY IN THE FIELDS.THESE FARMS ARE SAID TO BE VERY PROFITABLE ,ESPECIALLY IF THE HARVESTING WEATHER IS GOOD.
